newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore bunkers rally but are expected to soften.
newsitem.headline: Singapore bunkers rally but are expected to soften.

text.p: Singapore bunker quotes on Wednesday leaped further on news of a second U.S. missile strike on Iraq but shipowners were staying out of the market in expectation of lower prices, brokers said.
"Owners do not see the U.S./Iraq turmoil going into conflict. Prices will stay at this test level, then will slip down. Singapore bunker prices now are ridiculously high," one trader said.

Bunker 180 cst was quoted between $124-$128, up from Tuesday's $120-$125 while 380-cst rose to $120-124 from $115-$120. MDO rose to $205-$209 up from $190-$198 and gas oil firmed to $220 from $205-$206. --Singapore Newsroom (+65-8703082).
